body.p:
(A Copy)
Head Quarters 4th Div. 13th Army Corps
Matagorda Bay Texas
January 16th 1864
Honl W. H. Randall M. C.
Washington D. C.
Dear Sir:

I take the liberty of addressing you on behalf of Col. Wm J. Landram 19th Ky Infty, who commands the 1st Brigade of my Division; and to ask your influence in favor of his promotion. Col. Landram was among the first to volunteer from your state, and has commanded a Brigade or Division in the field for about two years reflecting credit upon his state and doing the country able service. He was engaged with his command at the battles of "Chickasaw Bayou," "Raymond," "Arkansas Post," "Port Gibson," "Champion Hills" "Black River Bridge" -- the seige of Vicksburg, and the battles at Jackson Miss., and in the arduous campaigns
in the West for two years -- distinguishing himself always for coolness and generalship where such qualities were indispensable; always popular with his troops and uniformly receiving the commendation of his superior officers.

After the fall of Vicksburg, General's Grant, Sherman, Logan, McPherson, McClernand, A. J. Smith, Carr, Hovey, McGinnis and other prominent officers united in a recommendation for his promotion to Brig. Genl Vols.

I trust this Congress will not adjourn without showing its appreciatiion of the really meritorius services of this gallant officer; and I ask you as his Representative in Congress to press his just claims upon their attention until his promotiion is secured.

Maj. Genl C. C. Washburne, lately in command of this Corps -- now on leave of absence -- will visit Washington this winter. He will do all he can for Col. Landram and can throw much of the Western influence in his favor

I have the honor to be
Very Respectfully Your Obedient Servt
signed T. E. G. Ransom
Brig. Gen. Vols_
(A copy)
